intro: Jaborosa leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Jaborosa leucotricha is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
